#Text=French citizens told to leave Ivory Coast as UN warns of civil war
#Text=Thursday , December 23 , 2010
#Text=Map highlighting location of the Ivory Coast .
#Text=Image : Vardion .
#Text=The French government has urged its citizens to leave the Ivory Coast ( Côte d'Ivoire ) as the United Nations ( U.N. ) warned that the country was heading towards a civil war .
#Text=According to the U.N. , there has been an increase in the use of intimidation methods by elements of the national security forces loyal to incumbent president Laurent Gbagbo .
#Text=" The international community must act and act decisively .

column1: #Text=Meanwhile , the French government urged its citizens to leave the country .
#Text=" We ask those who can , to leave Ivory Coast temporarily until the situation normalises , " said Francois Baroin , a government spokesperson .

#Text=On Saturday , Gbagbo ordered the U.N. and French peacekeepers to leave the country saying , " The government demands the departure of the UNOCI and LICORNE [ French ] forces in Ivory Coast and is opposed to any renewal of their mandate . "
#Text=Gbagbo claimed victory in the nation 's elections on November 28 .
#Text=Alassane Ouattara won the presidential run-off election on December 3 according to the country 's electoral commission .
#Text=However , the Constitutional Council has contested the announcement .
#Text=The French government and the U.N. have also rejected the election results .
#Text=Gbagbo offered for several entities to investigate the election results , which was rejected by Ouattara who said " we 've finished with these games . "

column1: #Text=" I am ... ready to welcome a committee ... headed by the African Union , involving ECOWAS , the Arab League , the United Nations , United States , the European Union , Russia and China , which will have permission to analyse objectively the facts of the electoral process ... to solve this crisis peacefully , " Gbagbo said in a statement .

column1: #Text=The U.N. said it has no plans to leave the country saying , " the president-elect is Ouattara and he has n't asked us to leave " and that they intend to " fulfill its mandate and will continue to monitor and document any human rights violations , incitement to hatred and violence , or attacks on U.N. peacekeepers . "

column1: #Text=Also on Saturday , a U.N. convoy and the mission headquarters in Abidjan was attacked by masked gunmen in military uniforms .
#Text=According to the mission , a civilian vehicle with six men inside approached the convoy .
#Text=When the convoy approached the compound 's entrance the gunmen opened fire .
#Text=No one was injured in the attack .
#Text=Shots were fired back at the gunmen , but none were hit .
